title: Add proper unit tests for register/unregister irqfd on aarch64
body:
Referencing [issue#67](https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/issues/67) and existing x86_64 code, proposing some code for testing successful register/unregister irqfd case on aarch64 machines after the failure cases. 

It passes the unit tests on both my x86_64 and aarch64 machines for now.

Signed-off-by: Henry Wang <<henry.wang@arm.com>>

title: Enable KVM_SET/GET_VCPU_EVENTS ioctls for Aarch64.
body:
Enable KVM_SET/GET_VCPU_EVENTS ioctls for Aarch64.

KVM_GET_VCPU_EVENTS and KVM_SET_VCPU_EVENTS ioctls have been supported
on Aarch64 from a recent kernel version.
This patch enables them on Aarch64 and checked cap KVM_CAP_VCPU_EVENTS
before calling them in test code to avoid error in old kernel.

Signed-off-by: Michael Zhao <michael.zhao@arm.com>

title: Release v0.4.0
body:
Changes are in the CHANGELOG.md file.

Fixes #59

title: use errno wrapper instead of io::Error in Result types
body:
Because io::Error type can have an ErrorKind that is meaningless to a vmm, a simple errno wrapper is preferred. Occasionally, the io::Error function that converts an errno to ErrorKind has some surprising mappings, although many of them simply map to Other, so I wish to sidestep the problem entirely.

For display purposes, the Display impl can simply pass through to io::Error, which does have a useful Display impl for any relevant errno.

Fixes #35

title: vm: Add a function to unregister ioeventfd
body:
The KVM_IOEVENTFD ioctl allows for both assigning and deassigning events
to a specific PIO or MMIO guest address. This commit introduces the
missing function to perform the deassignment.

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: test_clock fails intermittently
body:
Output of failing test here: https://buildkite.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls-ci/builds/338#6553ffb7-00fe-426b-9fa1-6340caacfdab

This issue needs scoping.

title: Cleanup - use modules defined in vmm-sys-util
body:
Changes:
- Removed ioctl macros from repository and use the ones defined in vmm-sys-util instead
- Fixed irqchip related tests
- use Eventfd instead of RawFd
- Remove Cargo.lock


Fixes: https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/issues/23 and https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/issues/39

title: Add proper tests for register/unregister irqfd on aarch64
body: Both the unit tests and the example only test the error cases on aarch64. We should add proper unit tests for these functions where the operations are successful & examples that actually call the functions.

title: Release v0.3.0
body: Changes are in the CHANGELOG.md file.

title: vcpu: Add wrapper for KVM_GET_ONE_REG.
body:
- add ioctl definition in kvm_ioctls.rs
- implement vcpu.get_one_reg()
- enable KVM_GET_ONE_REG / KVM_SET_ONE_REG for all platforms.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Sandu <sandreim@amazon.com>

title: Implement MsrList and Msrs as FamStructWrappers
body:
# Description of changes

`kvm_msr_list` and `kvm_msrs` each contain a flexible array member and were forcing users of `kvm-ioctls` crate to work with `unsafe` code.
Use the `kvm-bindings` `CpuId`, `MsrList` and `Msrs` safe wrappers over them and change our ioctl functions to use these safe wrappers.

title: Add missing support to allow `vm` and `vcpu` serialization
body:
# Description of changes

- Slightly rearranged the list of supported `ioctl`s and grouped them in `system`, `vm` and `vcpu`.
- Added support to safely set the kvm vcpu `immediate_exit` flag. This can be used to kick vcpus out of `KVM_RUN`.
- Made a fix to `KVM_SET_MSRS` to propagate the return value which signifies the number of MSRs _successfully_ written.
- Added support for missing ioctls necessary for vcpu serialization and deserialization:
    - KVM_GET_CPUID2
    - KVM_GET_MP_STATE
    - KVM_SET_MP_STATE
    - KVM_GET_VCPU_EVENTS
    - KVM_SET_VCPU_EVENTS
    - KVM_GET_DEBUGREGS
    - KVM_SET_DEBUGREGS
    - KVM_GET_XSAVE
    - KVM_SET_XSAVE
    - KVM_GET_XCRS
    - KVM_SET_XCRS
- Added support for missing ioctls necessary for vm serialization and deserialization:
    - KVM_GET_IRQCHIP
    - KVM_SET_IRQCHIP
    - KVM_GET_PIT2
    - KVM_SET_PIT2
    - KVM_GET_CLOCK
    - KVM_SET_CLOCK

title: Support for getting dirty logs on aarch64
body:
# Description of changes
This PR completes while also adjusting #33:
* `get_dirty_log` function is not `cfg` labeled anymore. The cfg labels were moved inside the doc comments for grouping architecturally specific variables and the examples was brought to a state that has as many similar line of codes between different architectures
* `test_run_code` was left as it was
* added main doc in `src/lib.rs` for aarch64 also

title: Implement FromRawFd for DeviceFd
body:
Implement FromRawFd for DeviceFd to recreate a DeviceFd object from a
raw fd.
Also export VmFd::new_vmfd() as pub.

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: add a changelog
body:
Added a changelog with details about the 2 past releases of
kvm-ioctls.

The changelog follows the format defined in
https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/.

title: kvm-ioctls 0.4.0
body: With cloud-hypervisor we're using the GSI routing ioctl (commit 37669f60). Since we've also added support `unregister_irqfd` since 0.2.0, and there are no pending new features, should we do a 0.3.0 release?

title: reimplement CpuId as a FamStructWrapper
body:
The CpuId type was implemented as a wrapper over the kvm_cpuid2
structure. Since kvm_cpuid2 contains a flexible array member,
we can reimplement CpuId as a FamStructWrapper<kvm_cpuid2>.

Signed-off-by: Serban Iorga <seriorga@amazon.com>

title: Add unregister_irqfd() to VmFd
body:
Add unregister_irqfd() to VmFd to unregister an irqfd from the KVM,
which will be needed when enabling supoort of MSI.

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

title: Add support for KVM_SET_GSI_ROUTING ioctl
body:
By adding the support for the ioctl KVM_SET_GSI_ROUTING, this commit
will allow consumers of the kvm-ioctls crate to set custom mappings for
GSI entries.

This would let a caller of this ioctl defines that GSI number X can
trigger an interrupt by delivering an MSI directly to the local APIC or
instead deliver a pin based interrupt to the in-kernel IOAPIC.

One example that comes to mind is to use this ioctl to let a VMM
interact with the VFIO API, as it requires an eventfd to be associated
with each interrupt. By combining this ioctl with KVM_IRQFD, one could
directly map an interrupt to an eventfd managed by KVM, and associated
to a specific GSI.

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: update rust-vmm-ci submodule
body:
rust-vmm-ci log:
8b60273 Run tests with rustvmm/dev:v3

title: Switch to rust vmm ci
body:
- Removed existing files related to the CI (test_coverage.py and, buildkite pipeline, coverage)
- Added rust-vmm-ci as a git submodule.

title: Update version to 0.2.0
body:
This is needed for publishing a new version on crates.io.

Changes since 0.1.0:
- Fix bug in `KvmRunWrapper`. The memory for `kvm_run` struct was
  not unmapped after the `KvmRunWrapper` object got out of scope.
- Return proper value when receiving the EOI KVM exit.
- Add support for KVM_ENABLE_CAP.
- Add support for KVM_SIGNAL_MSI.
- Mark `set_user_memory_region` as unsafe.

title: implement Drop for KvmRunWrapper
body:
In KvmRunWrapper we are mmaping memory for the kvm_run wrapper.
The memory needs to be unmapped before dropping the reference to
KvmRunWrapper.

title: vcpu: Return proper vector when receiving EOI
body:
The vector value returned along with End Of Interrupt (EOI) VM exit
is important as it indicates a userspace IOAPIC which interrupt needs
to be deasserted.

About KVM_EXIT_IOAPIC_EOI, KVM documentation mentions:
```
/* KVM_EXIT_IOAPIC_EOI */
struct {
    __u8 vector;
} eoi;

Indicates that the VCPU's in-kernel local APIC received an EOI for a
level-triggered IOAPIC interrupt. This exit only triggers when the
IOAPIC is implemented in userspace (i.e. KVM_CAP_SPLIT_IRQCHIP is
enabled); the userspace IOAPIC should process the EOI and retrigger
the interrupt if it is still asserted. Vector is the LAPIC interrupt
vector for which the EOI was received.
```

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: added CODEOWNERS
body: Fixes: https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/issues/32

title: Add support for KVM_ENABLE_CAP ioctl
body:
By adding the support for the ioctl KVM_ENABLE_CAP, this commit will
allow consumers of the kvm-ioctls crate to enable any KVM capability
they would be missing from their VMM implementation.

One example of capability that can be interesting to enable is the
newly added KVM_CAP_SPLIT_IRQCHIP, that allows the consumer to prevent
KVM from creating a virtual IOAPIC and PIC. This capability can let
a VMM provide its own userspace implementation of those components for
security purposes.

Signed-off-by: Sebastien Boeuf <sebastien.boeuf@intel.com>

title: Use rust-vmm-ci to test kvm-ioctls
body:
This PR depends on https://github.com/rust-vmm/rust-vmm-ci/pull/2.

It adds the rust-vmm-ci repository as a git submodule. The submodule points to my fork. Once we merge the rust-vmm-ci PR I will change it to point to the master branch of rust-vmm/rust-vmm-ci.

The Buildkite pipeline can now be found in rust-vmm-ci. You will notice that the CI fails now. That is because I deleted `.buildkite` and `tests/` as these are now moved to rust-vmm-ci.

This logic was tested by adding a dummy Buildkite project. You can see the tests run here: https://buildkite.com/rust-vmm/fandree-kvm-ioctls-ci

title: Switch to Container v2
body:
The v2 tag of the container uses Rust 1.34.0 and also has clippy installed for aarch64 builds.
Added clippy for aarch64 as well.

title: updated documentation for set_user_memory_region
body:
Added Safety section which explains why is the function unsafe and
what guarantees the caller needs to provide.

title: Update README to use rustvmm/dev instead of fandre/rust-vmm-dev
body:
Sections needing update:
- Running the tests
- Adaptive Coverage

title: mark `set_user_memory_region` as unsafe
body:
This function uses as parameter kvm_userspace_memory_region which is
a wrapper over a raw pointer (userspace_addr) and the size
(memory_size) so cannot know if the pointer refers to a valid memory.

Fixes: https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/issues/38

title: Buildkite pipeline
body:
- Added buildkite pipeline to repository
- Switch to rustvmm/dev container

title: Add support for KVM_SIGNAL_MSI
body:
This pull request primary goal is to add the support for the KVM ioctl `KVM_SIGNAL_MSI`.
The reason being to allow consumers of this crate to directly inject MSI messages instead of using legacy pin based interrupts.

The second part of this pull request implements the `Clone` trait for `VmFd` so that anyone can safely clone `VmFd`. The need for cloning is to be able to move the `VmFd` into a closure or a thread.

title: Remove `new_with_fd_number`
body:
The `new_with_fd_number` is an unsafe function for creating a `Kvm` object from a `RawFd`. Should we actually remove it and find other workarounds (if needed)? This function was used in Firecracker a while back to open kvm in the jailer process and pass the file descriptor to the firecracker process.

I would remove it because in all ioctl wrappers we assume that the Kvm object can only be created with Kvm::new and hence the `RawFd` corresponds to `/dev/kvm` which is not the case if we allow creating the Kvm object from unchecked file descriptors.

title: remove x86 labeling for KVM_GET_DIRTY_LOG
body:
KVM_GET_DIRTY_LOG is supported on arm too.
Look for kvm_vm_ioctl_get_dirty_log inside
linux's source file arch/arm/kvm/arm.c.
Helps with [Firecracker Issue](https://github.com/firecracker-microvm/firecracker/issues/866).

Signed-off-by: Diana Popa <dpopa@amazon.com>

title: functions that take a Rawfd should be unsafe
body: This crate allows registering eventfds with the kernel from safe code, but that function takes a raw file descriptor, and has no way to check that that the VM will not outlive the file descriptor. Thus, register_ioevent and register_irqfd should be unsafe (I didn't check if there are more instances).

title: set_user_memory_region shouldn't be safe
body:
This crate allows calling `set_user_memory_region` from safe code, but that function takes a raw pointer and length, and has no way to check that that refers to valid memory.

Shouldn't a safe version of that require passing a memory region type from the vm-memory crate?

title: Fix warnings
body: The warnings were hidden because in `src/lib.rs` we were using the `allow(unused)` macro. This unfortunately also hides the result unused warning.

title: Rename the `ioctls` module
body: `ioctls` is not the best name for the module. Anyone has a better suggestion?

title: use errno wrapper instead of io::Error in Result types
body:
Because `io::Error` type can have an `ErrorKind` that is meaningless to a vmm, a simple errno wrapper is preferred. Occasionally, the `io::Error` function that converts an errno to `ErrorKind` has some surprising mappings, although many of them simply map to `Other`, so I wish to sidestep the problem entirely.

For display purposes, the `Display` impl can simply pass through to `io::Error`, which does have a useful `Display` impl for any relevant errno.

title: test_create_device fails
body:
This problem was hidden because we weren't checking the result of `device_fd.set_device_attr(&dist_attr)`.

Output:
```
---- ioctls::device::tests::test_create_device stdout ----
thread 'ioctls::device::tests::test_create_device' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Os { code: 25, kind: Other, message: "Inappropriate ioctl for device" }', libcore/result.rs:1009:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```

title: Aarch64/test run code
body: I still don't know Rust, but copying x86 code and modifying it for AArch64 wasn't too bad... Question: is there any way to share boilerplate test code? Creating VM's and VCPU's are required for each test, so we get a lot of redundant lines. Thanks, drew

title: Add CODEOWNERS file
body:
Please add a CODEOWNERS file with the details of the maintainers. Please use the following format as outlined in: https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-code-owners

Most projects can simply follow the wildcard syntax. e.g.

`* @owner1 @owner2`

Not only does this provide a way to see who is responsible or this repository they will also automatically be notified of incoming PR reviews.

body: Commit 95279983 moved them from being exported to being private.

title: kvm system ioctls: updated public functions docs
body:
## Changes
Added examples and more details for public functions.
Also renamed get_run_size() to run_size().

## Note:
`cargo test` will also run the documentation examples. Even if some examples are simple and just call the function it can help us in the future to keep the documentation updated as we make code changes (cargo test fails otherwise).

## How to test it locally
The best way to review this PR is by generating the documentation as follows:

```
# Clone Repo
git clone git@github.com:rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls.git
cd kvm-ioctls
# Fetch the code from my fork 
git fetch https://github.com/andreeaflorescu/kvm-ioctls.git pub_docs
git checkout FETCH_HEAD
# Generate and open the documentation 
cargo doc --open
```

## Still missing

High level crate design & usage. Will add this as part of fixing #21

body:
`cargo test` is functional on aarch64 too.
Fixes https://github.com/firecracker-microvm/firecracker/issues/1040.

Signed-off-by: Diana Popa <dpopa@amazon.com>

title: Add ARM specific coverage test
body:
Our CI is checking is the coverage was decreased by looking at the value in [tests/coverage](https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/blob/master/tests/coverage). Check `test_coverage` in [test_coverage.py](https://github.com/rust-vmm/kvm-ioctls/blob/master/tests/test_coverage.py).

As coverage will be different on arm and x86 because of different ioctls and code paths that can be exercised on each platform, we should also have different coverage files and update the test to use different files for different platforms.

title: implement KvmVec struct
body: KvmVec provides a common abstraction for all the KVM structures that resemble arrays. For example: CpuId and MsrList

title: Correctly label x86/x86_64 specific code
body: Test it with `cargo build --target aarch64-unknown-linux-musl`

title: add development & CI test profiles
body:
Added two test profiles: one for development (devel) and one for
running the integration tests as part of the CI.

Currently the only difference between the two is running the
coverage test. Specifically, in the `ci` profile the test fails
if current_coverage > previous_coverage, while in the `devel`
profile the coverage file is updated with the new value.

Signed-off-by: Andreea Florescu <fandree@amazon.com>

title: Kvm ioctls
body:
Added wrappers over KVM ioctls. The wrappers are split in 3 categories:
- system ioctls (as part of the `Kvm` implementation)
- VM ioctls (as part of the `VmFd` implementation) - probably I'll rename it to Vm
- Vcpu ioctls (as part of the `VcuFd` implementation) - probably I'll rename it to Vcpu

I still have to add some examples & ioctls used by CrosVM & some other tests.

title: init crate
body:
Created a dummy crate with version 0.0.1 so we can publish it on
crates.io and reserve the kvm-ioctls name.

Added Apache-v2.0 License.

title: added KVM system ioctls
body:
Feature parity with CrosVM & Firecracker in terms of system ioctls.
The ioctls on VM & vCPU will be added later.
